name: Ca' Pisani Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In 6 previous trips to Venice we had always stayed in the San Marco area and on the Grand Canal. Ever since it opened a few years ago, however, I've kept an eye on the Ca' Pisani which was the first "design hotel" in Venice, and situated in the Dorsoduro area (sestiere) near the Accademia. This trip, staying 8 days, I convinced my husband to take a chance and try the place. We loved it. We enjoyed staying in Dorsoduro and found the place just about perfect for our needs and our tastes.
reviews.title: Art Deco gem

reviews.text: I find the "opulence" of everything Venetian gets a little heavy after a while--in a hotel room, at least. Furnishings are often gold embossed or trimmed velvet or damask, usually in dark blue or blood red. After just so much of that I begin to fear that the heavy drapes will fall on me. I like the clean, modern look found in design hotels. Ca' Pisani delivers on clean and design though the look is retro Art Deco rather than modern. That's more than ok with me since Art Nouveau and Art Deco are my real favorite design eras.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: This place pulls out all the stops on Art Deco. The public rooms and spacious hallways are filled with lovely pieces and some of the "art" is designs of art deco furnishings. No expense has been spared to make things look very authentic. Check the hotel pix on the Expedia site (which I think are the ones you get to when you click hotel pictures on this site) and you will see an example of a guest room door with its inlaid multii-colored wood designs. It's that kind of a place.
reviews.title: I really liked this hotel!

reviews.text: This design theme carries over into the guest rooms. We opted for their standard double. It is not pictured on the Expedia site, being smaller than the rooms shown, but it certainly provided ample space for us and seemed larger than most Venice standard doubles in my experience. The furnishings in our room were also a bit darker and heavier than those shown in the Expedia pix, so if you crave light and airy this may not be the place for you. I'm going to try to attach pictures we took of our room and bathroom to provide some idea of what I'm trying to explain.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel from all points of view

reviews.text: The bedding was pleasantly modern, light weight, and comfortable. (I would love to have taken the crisp, cool, lineney sheets home with me) The mattresses were firm, very much to our liking. The bathrooms were spotless and kitted out in brownish marble with flecks of sparkles, and beautiful, streamlined art deco plumbing fixtures. Our room had a jacuzzi tub--and a window to let in some light.
reviews.title: Great hotel with xcellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we purchased a return ticket on the red line of the water buses, quite slow, took about 1 hour and 20 minutes and cost 50 euros for 2 return tickets. It will pay you to research your trip as to how many times you want to use the water bus service and purchase a 48, 72 hours etc. travel card. This will save you in the long run, we got off at Zattere which was a 4 minute walk to the hotel (excellent). Hotel very friendly on arrival, room spacious and clean, shower brilliant 5 heads,1 on top and 4 down the sides, although toiletries sparse, no small bottles but hair and shower gel (together) in container (take your own). Takes about 20 minutes to walk to St Marks and Rialto Bridge. Research restaurants as all seem expensive due to weak pounds. Would highly recommend Dona Onesta in Dorsoduro excellent , friendly and reasonable. Took up the complimentary Muriano trip from the hotel, good trip but can be daunting as the glass is expensive and you are shown around it with the guide, just be honest if you don't want to purchase and then look around Mariano Island. You can use the computer and printer at the hotel which is great for online checkin. Buffet breakfast very good, lots of variety. All in all a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Returning To Venice

reviews.text: As Venice has so much to offer we wanted a hotel which was convenient, friendly, not stuffy but which in this City wouldn't cost the earth. The Ca'Pisani was great - and since then I've also arranged for my parents to stay there too and they were equally enchanted. It's got a great location, stylish and good-sized rooms and common areas. The restaurant and bar is small but very good quality - modern Venetian food and excellent breakfasts. The staff couldn't have been more helpful (including sourcing wellies to cope with unexpected (to us) flooding). It's small enough to feel personal but not so small that it doesn't have all the amanities and to a high standard.
reviews.title: Were won over by the boutique Ca'Pisani

reviews.text: We stepped off the Vaporetto at Zattere around midnight in the sweltering Venetian heat. The short walk to the Hotal Ca Pisani was magical and as we stepped through the beautiful entrance into the icy cool reception moments before we melted into the grand canal we were greeted by name by the always friendly and welcoming staff. My daughter (Age 5) and I were shown to our room (number 8) and after much delight with the fish shaped door key, were enchanted by the mini suite with glass staircase and mezzanine floor. We took a jacuzzi in the glittering bathroom before retiring to sleep feeling like princesses. Venice is one of the most beautiful places in the world, and Marianna and the staff at the Ca Pisani enhance the experience for me every time I visit. I have stayed there several times and would never stay anywhere else. The hotel is filled with beautiful Italian vintage furniture pieces carefully chosen to compliment some very modern Italian touches and some excellent examples of contemporary art. Extremely stylish, interesting and comfortable. There is a lovely secret terrace upstairs with a fantastic view of the Venetian rooftops and the hotels central location makes it ideal for sightseeing. Considering all it has to offer I think it is very reasonably priced. A very special place.
reviews.title: My Favourite Place in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ca'Pisani is a real dream hotel located in the charming academia bridge area in a wonderfully restored Venezian Palazzo. The hotel espresses thte unique mix from being carefully restored remaining the character of the builiding with a stylish, extravagant interior design.
reviews.title: In the Ca'Pisani all your wishes come true!
Old Venice mixed with botique design
reviews.text: The Ca'Pisani team is reading in your eyes your wishes and gives you the feeling of being and coming home ... we spent x-mas there since 9 years and every visit is a very special one ... also in summers every second year we go there to visit the Biennale and although travelling much all of the world ... the Ca'Pisani ist the nicest hotel we have ever been.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the pleasure to stay at ca' pisani with my husband 3 weeks ago and we really enjoyed our stay. nice location: downtown but at the same time out of the crowds, wonderful staff both at reception and the restaurant, and original decoration. the hotel is member of 'design hotels' and they do have pieces of furniture and decor form the forties, along with modern technology like (free) wi-fi connection in all the rooms. we will suggest this little nice jewel hotel to all our friends! (and we will hopefully be back soon)
reviews.title: nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Interesting hotel, but some quirks that I trust have been worked out since our stay. Upon check in, we went with the bellhop to a room that had other guests staying in it already--it was an awkward situation. We went back down to the lobby and were reassigned another room, which was nice if not unremarkable.
reviews.title: Quirky Good, Quirky Bad

reviews.text: Later that day, we took some friends to see our room (they were staying next door at another hotel) and all 5 of us got stuck in the elevator for over an hour! After we were unceremoniously released from our prison, all we were offered was one beverage from the bar and a very terse apology. Mind you, this was in the middle of summer and it was disturbingly hot in there... We also didn't have a lot of time to spend in Venice and it took a solid chunk out of our stay there.
reviews.title: Excellent services, meticulous interior design, very central.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly, in our shower, the odd 'designer' soap dispenser that had no soap in it. We had to call to get it filled with some strange powder. Perhaps this too has changed since... Awkward moment when my wife had to wait in her bathrobe while staff came in to refill the dispenser...
reviews.title: Be sure to book water taxi roundtrip!
This is a great hotel and we had a lovely time.
reviews.text: These quirks added up to an experience that was a bit strange and off-putting, but I wouldn't expect everybody to have the same experience--perhaps bad luck on our end. I just regret that they weren't as apologetic as I would have expected for the elevator mishap and didn't offer us anything besides a luke warm drink and apology. I don't know if it was worth spending the money that we spent, but it was an experience nonetheless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 nights at this lovely hotel. It is in a fantastic location, central but away from the crowds. The decor is superb and the staff are wonderful. We have been to Venice many times as it is our favourite city and this is by far the nicest hotel we have stayed in. It was our anniversary whilst we were there and we had taken our cards which the staff must have seen and when we returned that day there was an ice bucket with a bottle of prosecco. We took it up to the rooftop to drink - a lovely touch! We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Wonderful in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ca'Pisani was our second choice but I am so glad we stayed there. The location just 2 mins walk off the Academia vaporetta stop was perfect. It was central yet not smack in the crowded area of St Mark's. Hotel room was actually decent sized for Italy and hot breakfast was a nice inclusion. Would highly recommend it for people who like modern furnishings in a convenient location in Venice. We stumbled upon a wonderful concert just across the bridge one night (Chiesa di San Vidal), which just added to our wonderful Venice experience. PS: make sure you get across to Murano esp. if you like jewelry!
reviews.title: Perfect bolt holt for busy Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel. Fine attention to taste, design and details throughout. Excellent location, close to everything, yet slightly out of the crush of the tourist hubbub. This means it is quiet and relaxing. The employees went out of their way to help us in every way. The owner is a Masters Swimmer, as am I, and she introduced me to her Venetian swim club with which I trained.
reviews.title: Beautiful, tasteful hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: Ca Pisani is a terrific hotel just 5 minutes walk from St. Marks. The decor is modern and pretty funky and the bedrooms and bathrooms are terrific. The staff were attentive and responsive at all times and really made our stay enjoyable. There is a great buffet style breakfast available each day and the food was always fresh and plentiful. Concierge was really helpful and well informed about restaurants and local attractions. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to visitors to Venice.
reviews.title: Modern hotel with excellent service and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ca Pisani is everything you hope for in a hotel - good location, beautiful decor, comfortable bed and absolutely outstanding staff. Easy to find, this lovely hotel is completely decorated throughout in Art Deco style - every detail is beautifully included. If you just admire a hotel for it's stylishness, you will be impressed, if you personally like Art Deco you will be delighted. The hotel has a small steam-room which can be booked and a roof-top terrace with views across the terracotta roofs of the city. The staff at the hotel, from the extremely helpful Thomass in reception, to the shy girl who made the best coffee we had tasted since arriving in Europe 5 months ago, were without exception, outstanding. It was no trouble to recommend good local restaurants, give directions, make reservations, you name it, it was done with a friendly smile. The food at the breakfast buffet was very nice, so nice we returned and had something from the small 'snack' menu at lunch time. We enjoyed the luxurious surroundings and wonderful furniture of the Junior Suite and it was a pleasure to return in the evening from a day's sightseeing to find the room clean, with chocolates on the pillow. There was a small sitting-room area, and the bathroom had a large separate shower, plus a marble bath/jacuzzi and toilet + bidet. We also asked to view a standard room, and although this did not have the separate shower, it still had the fabulous marble bath/jacuzzi, so we believe the standard room would be just as enjoyable. We would without hesitation, stay at Ca Pisani again, and have already recommended it to several friends who are planning a visit to Venice.
reviews.title: Stupendously Good!

description: Ca' Pisani, the first design hotel in town, opened in December 2000 after almost 3 years of restoration works. it is a stone's throw from the Grand Canal and the Guggenheim collection, and is located in an original late 16th century building. inside, art deco atmosphere and modern comfort, including free wi-fi connection. Family owned and run by a Venetian family whose members have been hoteliers since 1908.
